input: Bob is rough. Erin is blue. Erin is nice. Erin is red. Fiona is blue. Fiona is red. Fiona is rough. Fiona is round. Gary is red. Gary is round. All rough things are round. If Bob is rough and Bob is blue then Bob is white. All smart things are round. Red things are smart. If something is white and nice then it is round. Smart, nice things are round. All rough, round things are red. All blue things are nice. All smart things are blue. Question: Bob is white.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Fiona : obj
constant Gary : obj

constant Rough : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Round : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Rough Bob
axiom T2 : Blue Erin
axiom T3 : Nice Erin
axiom T4 : Red Erin
axiom T5 : Blue Fiona
axiom T6 : Red Fiona
axiom T7 : Rough Fiona
axiom T8 : Round Fiona
axiom T9 : Red Gary
axiom T10 : Round Gary

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x → Round x
axiom R2 : Rough Bob ∧ Blue Bob → White Bob
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Round x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Smart x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Nice x → Round x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x ∧ Nice x → Round x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Rough x ∧ Round x → Red x
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Nice x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, Smart x → Blue x

theorem bob_is_white : White Bob :=
begin
  apply R2,
  split,
  exact T1,
  apply R9,
  apply R4,
  apply R7,
  split,
  exact T1,
  apply R1,
  exact T1,
end

-- The answer is True
